description.narrative:
The Kiribati Technical and Vocational Education and Training Sector Strengthening Program (TVETSSP) aims to improve the quality of technical and vocational education and training at the Kiribati Institute of Technology (KIT) and strengthen employment opportunities for I-Kiribati.
The program was designed in two Phases. Phase I commenced in January 2011 and was eighteen months duration. Phase II was a four-year direct continuation of Phase I and concluded on 30 September 2016.
The Program was designed with two components: Component 1: Focused on strengthening the Ministry of Labour and Human Resource Development (MLHRD) – TVET sector policy, planning and oversight; Component 2: Focused on increasing the quality, quantity, scope and equity of training delivered by the Kiribati Institute of Technology (KIT).
TVETSSP achieved most of the outcomes DFAT expected over the lifetime of the investment. Component 1 was discontinued in June 2014 and partially achieved its outcome to increas
